datafield.subfield: University of Michigan Retirees Association records,

Founded in March 1953, the University Retirees Association (formerly the Annuitants Association) was established to promote the individual and collective interests of annuitants and to afford the advantages of organized programs of studies and activities,

including informing annuitants of their rights and privileges; investigating need readjustments of annuity payments; advising prospective annuitants regarding ways of meeting the requirements for social security benefits;

investigating opportunities for part-time employment for retired staff members; planning advisory services to annuitants and their survivors; planning conferences, social affairs, and studies as the membership may desire. The records document the association's history of action in advocating the support of retirees mainly from the University of Michigan.

At its outset the group focused on income-related issues, based on the realization that many retired persons needed improved financial support. Later the group turned to areas of general support by the University of privileges of its retirees, such as continued health coverage, use of University library facilities and office space, and use of athletic facilities.

Record volumes include executive committee agenda and minutes, general meeting agenda and minutes, and correspondence. Also included are files of Big 11 Retirees Association that consist of comparisons of cost of living vs. income for retirees, compilations of public resources for retirees, and minutes of the Big 11 Conference.
